meanings.definition: An optical illusion caused by atmospheric conditions, especially the appearance of water in a desert.
meanings.sent1: The travelers in the desert were fooled by the mirage of a shimmering oasis.
meanings.sent2: The mirage of a distant lake made the parched explorer hopeful.
meanings.sent3: The mirage of a giant ice cream cone in the desert made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The mirage of success can sometimes lead people astray.
meanings.sent5: The mirage of safety in the storm turned out to be a cruel trick of nature.

meanings.definition: Something that appears real or possible but is not actually so.
meanings.sent1: The promise of easy money turned out to be just a mirage.
meanings.sent2: The mirage of a perfect relationship shattered when reality set in.
meanings.sent3: The mirage of a bottomless pit of candy seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent4: The mirage of eternal youth is a common theme in literature.
meanings.sent5: The mirage of fame can sometimes cloud one's judgment.
